title._content: 7 year old Tommie Nooman demonstrating the advantages of the Ideal Necktie Form in store window, April 1911

description._content: Original Caption: After 9 P.M., 7 year old Tommie Nooman demonstrating the advantages of the Ideal Necktie Form in store window on Pennsylvania Ave., Washington, D.C. His father said, He is the youngest demonstrator in America. Has been doing it for several years from San Francisco, to New York. We stay a month or six weeks in a place, he works at it off and on. The remarks of appreciation from the by-standers were not having the best effect on Tommie. Washington, D.C, April 1911 U.S. National Archives’ Local Identifier: 102-LH-2375 Photographer: Hine, Lewis Subjects: Child Labor National Child Labor Committee Working Conditions Factory Persistent URL: research.archives.gov/description/523446 Repository: Still Picture Records Section, Special Media Archives Services Division (NWCS-S), National Archives at College Park, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD, 20740-6001.
